alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 01 at 1:35PM MDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Kootenai and Shoshone Counties. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. For the Coeur d`Alene River...including Cataldo...and the St Joe River at St Maries...Flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 32.5 feet, Minor flooding will occur throughout the low lying areas of the St Joe Valley. Water will be observed behind levees due to seepage. Minor flooding of the Aqua Park`s boat launch and swim beach along the river`s edge. Outbuildings along the river that are not behind levees may be flooded. At 33.0 feet, Water may be over St Joe City Road, east of St. Maries to Calder. At 35.0 feet, Water will be up to Aqua Avenue in St Maries near Leeve hill and walking trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM PDT Monday the stage was 29.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday morning. The river is forecast to rise to near 34.0 feet late Thursday and remain betweeen 33 and 34 feet through the weekend. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu St Joe River St Maries 32.5 29.3 Mon 11 am PD 31.0 32.8 33.6 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM PDT.
